section.title: Introduction to Virtualization Hosts
section.para: ovirt-engine supports both virtualization hosts which run the oVirt Node, and those which run Fedora. Both types of virtualization host are able to coexist in the same oVirt environment.
Prior to installing virtualization hosts you should ensure that:

listitem.para: all virtualization hosts meet the hardware requirements, and
you have successfully completed installation of the oVirt Engine.

section.para: Additionally you may have chosen to install the oVirt Engine Reports. This is not mandatory and is not required to commence installing virtualization hosts. Once you have completed the above tasks you are ready to install virtualization hosts.

important.title: Important â€” Attach at Least Two Virtualization Hosts
important.para: It is recommended that you install at least two virtualization hosts and attach them to the ovirt-engine environment. Where you attach only one virtualization host you will be unable to access features such as migration which require redundant hosts..
